author: Special Correspondent
text:
City has third largest number of migrants from other States

Greater Chennai Corporation covering 24 Assembly constituencies and six Parliamentary constituencies, has emerged as the city with the third largest number of migrants from other States, said Mayor Saidai Duraisamy.

Speaking at the Corporation Council meeting on Saturday, Mr. Duraisamy said New Delhi and Mumbai were the only two cities ahead of Greater Chennai Corporation in terms of number of residents from other parts of the country living there.

“Welfare measures of the State government have been targeted at all the 70.88 lakh residents in the city. The number of councillors has increased from 155 to 200. They represent various cultures and languages,” said Mr. Duraisamy.

The Council on Saturday thanked Chief Minister Jayalalithaa for inaugurating Greater Chennai Corporation covering 426 sq km of Chennai, Kancheepuram and Tiruvallur districts.

Pointing to the huge migration of residents from other parts of the country, Mr. Duraisamy said industrial growth, planned residential development and commercial development continued to attract people.

“The State government has implemented infrastructure projects and initiated welfare measures of migrant labourers. Planning and implementation of such projects has kept pace with expectation of the residents in the city. Greater Chennai Corporation will provide all civic amenities for all the people,” said Mr. Duraisamy.
title: It’s all about the glories of Greater Chennai
